column4: why isnt there a single linux file system with transparent compression?!
compressing files on write, transparent to programs and users
nolimitsoya, I think it's because it's stupid :)
saves diskspace, saves i/o, boosts performance. thats not stupid :)
see everything has to be compressed and uncompressed, if not on your harddrive then on the system memory.
do the benchmarks yourself. ;) in diskintensive usage, it does wonders
usualy you have loads of cpu cycels doing nothing
at what cost to the cpu?
but to answer your question, I don't think there is such thing.
i know there isnt, i just wonder why :)
